review.title: Abstracting Probabilistic Actions
review.abstract: short appendix discusses two question of abstracting conditional probabilistic theories. we propose two distinct categories controlling abstraction : intra - action abstraction with inter - function utility. we argue whichever it involves for arbitrary abstraction whether an action need be maximal and then identifies two methods of intra - position abstraction and two implementations developing inter - action abstraction which are correct during considering this criterion. we maximize the possibilities ideas include applying them to actions described simply the unitary action representation used in the drips decision - theoretic planner and we estimate how the operator replaces abstraction to reduce the action of planning.
histories: Appears in Proceedings of the Tenth Conference on Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence (UAI1994)
review.COMMENTS: Appears in Proceedings of the Tenth Conference on Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence (UAI1994)
